Html.content:
The virtual file system provides the usual features of a "normal" file system:

  • Files and folders can be moved, copied and deleted
  • Permissions can be set
  • Resources are locked if someone edits them
  • Resources have a creation and a "last modified" date

But the VFS comes also with some extra features:

  • Resources are typed (finer than just distinguishing file and folder)
  • Resources also have, potentially, user-defined properties attached
  • Resources in the system can be related (i.e., a dependency between them is established)
  • The history of resources (state when publishing a resource) can be saved and restored
  • When resources are moved, links are automatically adjusted (if the link-relationship-engine is used)

Moreover, the traditional workplace's explorer allows you to publish resources. But more on this in the next section.
